body_html:
I reproduced this, and it seems to actually be an issue in the way the resolver behaves in pipenv.

See pypa/pipenv#1988 and pypa/pipenv#2490 (comment) outlines that it's a current constraint with pipenv, i.e. providing a .post1 for only some platforms will screw with it's resolver.

They mentioned that new resolver logic is already underway.
It should also be fixed with the next PyTorch version.
body_text:
I reproduced this, and it seems to actually be an issue in the way the resolver behaves in pipenv.
See pypa/pipenv#1988 and pypa/pipenv#2490 (comment) outlines that it's a current constraint with pipenv, i.e. providing a .post1 for only some platforms will screw with it's resolver.
They mentioned that new resolver logic is already underway.
It should also be fixed with the next PyTorch version.
body:
I reproduced this, and it seems to actually be an issue in the way the resolver behaves in `pipenv`. 

See https://github.com/pypa/pipenv/issues/1988 and https://github.com/pypa/pipenv/issues/2490#issuecomment-401860216 outlines that it's a current constraint with `pipenv`, i.e. providing a `.post1` for only some platforms will screw with it's resolver.

They mentioned that new resolver logic is already underway.
It should also be fixed with the next PyTorch version.
